item.author: contact@example.org (FunWithData)
item.description: In mathematics, a curve (also called a curved line in older texts) is, generally speaking, an object similar to a line but that need not be straight. Thus, a curve is a generalization of a line, in that it may be curved.

item.author: contact@example.org (FunWithData)
item.description: General Principles of Performance Evaluation For Prediction - (prediction methods are used for generating numerical predictions) a) MAE (mean absolute error/deviation)= MAE gives the magniture of the average absolute error b) Mean Error = the Mean Error is similar to MAE except that it returns the sign of the error, and therefore gives an indication of whether the prediction are over or underpredicting the outcome variable on average.
